Description: Rim (incurving) and body sherd of North Ionian (?) pottery bird bowl; interior: glazed with band of narrow white and purple stripes; exterior: bird with hatched body and part of a rosette; top of rim glazed, and glazed below frieze.; cream-colour slip on the exterior.
Curator's comments: See also A. W. Johnston, Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (London 1978), no. 43.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 255, no. 4)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 43)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.066)
